tool.name: build_element_lists

param.name: in_Bounds
param.dialogReference:
Input polygon feature class representing boundaries for which Elements will be summarized.

NOTE: Typically, this will be the Conservation Sites, but any boundaries may be used.

param.name: fld_ID
param.dialogReference:
Field(s) in the input boundary feature class used to uniquely identify polygons. The selected field(s) will be included in the output table.

NOTE: If using Conservation Sites as the boundaries, SITENAME is the suggested field to use for identification.

param.name: in_procEOs
param.dialogReference: Input processed EOs, resulting from running the "Build Conservation Portfolio" tool.

param.name: in_elementTab
param.dialogReference: Input updated Element Portfolio Summary table, resulting from running the "Build Conservation Portfolio" tool.

param.name: out_gdb
param.dialogReference: Output Geodatabase. Output files with standard names will be written here.

param.name: out_folder
param.dialogReference: Output Folder for excel files. Output files with standard names will be written here.

param.name: suf
param.dialogReference:
Text to add to the base output file name(s).

Generally, you should not alter this from the default value, which auto-populates based the primary input to this tool.

tool.summary: Creates a master list relating a summary of processed, viable EOs to a set of boundary polygons, which could be Conservation Sites (default), Natural Area Preserves, parcels, or any other boundaries. The output table is sorted by polygon ID, Element, tier, and G-rank. Optionally, the output table can be exported to an excel spreadsheet.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Creates a master list relating a summary of processed, viable EOs to a set of boundary polygons, which could be Conservation Sites, Natural Area Preserves, parcels, or any other boundaries. The output table is sorted by polygon ID, Element, tier, and G-rank. Optionally, the output table can be exported to an excel spreadsheet.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Virginia Natural Heritage Program (Kirsten R. Hazler)
